item.title: Beyond Founder Mode: Mission Mode
item.description: In the discussion of startup management, Noam Perski argues that “Mission Mode” is essential for addressing critical problems. Unlike Paul Graham’s “Founder Mode,” which emphasizes founder involvement, mission mode prioritizes organizing around customer needs. It requires every team member to work with urgency, focusing on meaningful outcomes. Perski highlights that companies like Palantir have successfully employed this approach for two decades, tackling complex challenges by embedding…

item.title: Inside the AIPCon 8 Demos Redefining the Future of Enterprise AI
item.description: üöÄ AIPCon 8 showcased transformative AI applications across various industries, highlighting real-world solutions at Palantir’s recent conference. From healthcare to motorsport, demos featured innovations like Andretti’s RaceOS for rapid data-driven decisions and Nebraska Medicine’s automated documentation for efficient revenue cycle management. These advancements illustrate how AI can solve operational challenges and enhance efficiency. #EnterpriseAI #AIPCon8 #Innovation #Healthcare #Motorsport

item.title: How Palantir‚Äôs Strategic Privacy Investments Enable Future Customer Success
item.description: Palantir is enhancing customer success through strategic privacy investments in its software platforms. Their tools, like granular access controls and data lineage, ensure sensitive data is handled securely. A key feature, Checkpoints, allows users to provide purpose justification for sensitive actions, improving compliance and governance. Checkpoints integrate with over 60 actions, helping organizations meet regulatory requirements and manage AI workflows effectively. Learn how these…

item.title: Defensive Databases: Optimizing Index-Refresh Semantics
item.description: üöÄ Palantir’s Foundations team is enhancing Elasticsearch (ES) to boost stability without forking the source code. This post discusses how they customize ES by optimizing indexing refresh semantics to avoid bad access patterns. With over 300 ES clusters in various environments, maintaining reliability is crucial. The team aims to share insights with the Elastic community for potential improvements in the mainline offering. üîó Read more about their approach and solutions in the full article!…

item.title: Correcting the Record: Response to the Recent American Conservative Article on Palantir
item.description: Palantir addresses recent allegations from the American Conservative questioning its commitment to privacy and civil liberties. The response clarifies that Palantir is not a surveillance company and does not engage in or promote unlawful surveillance practices. The article misrepresents Palantir’s work with intelligence agencies, particularly regarding claims related to the NSA’s XKEYSCORE tool. Palantir emphasizes its dedication to privacy laws and governance safeguards, ensuring that its…

item.title: About Palantir
item.description: üîç Interested in Palantir? Here‚Äôs a quick overview! Palantir Technologies, founded in 2003 and headquartered in Denver, offers software for data operations and AI infrastructure. Their solutions support organizations in various sectors, including defense, healthcare, and finance. Their platforms integrate diverse data sources to enhance decision-making, while ensuring customer data remains secure and controlled. Notably, Palantir does not act as a data collector or broker. For more insights,…

item.title: Scaling On-Prem Security at Palantir
item.description: Palantir emphasizes security in its on-premises solutions, tailoring approaches for various environments. üåê The Insight tool enhances security by automating checks on server configurations, ensuring compliance with rigorous standards. It allows users to run scans and generate reports easily. üìä With the integration of Foundry and Apollo, Palantir streamlines the review process, improving visibility and collaboration. üîç Learn more about how Palantir maintains security across thousands of…

item.title: America‚Äôs AI Action Plan
item.description: üöÄ On July 23, 2025, the White House released “Winning the AI Race: America‚Äôs AI Action Plan,” aiming to boost U.S. leadership in AI through 90+ federal policy actions. Key focuses include: - Promoting commercial AI solutions in federal procurement, especially for the DoD. - Streamlining processes for AI system approvals and leveraging existing platforms like Maven and Army Vantage. The plan emphasizes the role of testbeds for efficient AI deployment, ensuring systems meet mission-critical…
